edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption
Class ScElGamalOnGroupElement

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption.ElGamalAbs
      edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption.ScElGamalOnGroupElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
AsymmetricEnc, AsymMultiplicativeHomomorphicEnc, ElGamalEnc, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, SecurityLevel
public class ScElGamalOnGroupElement
extends ElGamalAbs
implements AsymMultiplicativeHomomorphicEnc

This class performs the El Gamal encryption scheme that perform the encryption on a GroupElement.

In some cases there are protocols that do multiple calculations and might want to keep working on a close group. For those cases we provide encryption on a group element.

By definition, this encryption scheme is CPA-secure and Indistinguishable.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

multiply

public AsymmetricCiphertext multiply(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher1,
                                     AsymmetricCiphertext cipher2)
Calculates the ciphertext resulting of multiplying two given ciphertexts. Both ciphertexts have to have been generated with the same public key and DlogGroup as the underlying objects of this ElGamal object.

Specified by:
multiply in interface AsymMultiplicativeHomomorphicEnc
Returns:
the multiplication result
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases: 1. If one or more of the given ciphertexts is not instance of ElGamalOnGroupElementCiphertext. 2. If one or more of the GroupElements in the given ciphertexts is not a member of the underlying DlogGroup of this ElGamal encryption scheme.

multiply

public AsymmetricCiphertext multiply(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher1,
                                     AsymmetricCiphertext cipher2,
                                     java.math.BigInteger w)
Calculates the ciphertext resulting of multiplying two given ciphertexts.

Both ciphertexts have to have been generated with the same public key and DlogGroup as the underlying objects of this ElGamal object.

There are cases when the random value is used after the function, for example, in sigma protocol. In these cases the random value should be known to the user. We decided not to have function that return it to the user since this can cause problems when the multiply function is called more than one time. Instead, we decided to have an additional multiply function that gets the random value from the user.

Specified by:
multiply in interface AsymMultiplicativeHomomorphicEnc
w - The random value used in the function.
Returns:
the multiplication result
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases: 1. If one or more of the given ciphertexts is not instance of ElGamalOnGroupElementCiphertext. 2. If one or more of the GroupElements in the given ciphertexts is not a member of the underlying DlogGroup of this ElGamal encryption scheme.

generateCiphertext

@Deprecated
public AsymmetricCiphertext generateCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
Deprecated. As of SCAPI-V1-0-2-2 use reconstructCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)

Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
Generates (reconstructs) a suitable AsymmetricCiphertext from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

We emphasize that this is NOT in any way an encryption function, it just receives ENCRYPTED DATA and places it in a ciphertext object.

Specified by:
generateCiphertext in interface AsymmetricEnc
Parameters:
data - contains all the necessary information to construct a suitable ciphertext.
Returns:
the AsymmetricCiphertext that corresponds to the implementing encryption scheme, for ex: CramerShoupCiphertext
See Also:
AsymmetricEnc.generateCiphertext(edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.ciphertext.AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData)

Reconstructs a suitable AsymmetricCiphertext from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).
